cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for. the War Cabinet. November 1944.SECRET. Copy No. 61W.M. (44)143rd Conclusions.WAR CABINET 143 (44).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Wednesday, 1st November, 1944, at 5-30 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P.,Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The Right Hon. Herbert Morrison,M.P., Secretary of State for theHome Department. and Minister ofHome Security.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Chancellor of the Exchequer.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The Right Hon. Lord Woolton,Minister of Reconstruction.The following were also present:The Right Hon. Viscount Cranborne,Secretary of State for DominionAffairs.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.The right.P.Hon. Brendan Bracken,The Right Hon. Lord Beaverbrook,Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Minister of aircraft production.The Right Hon.Richard Law, M.P.Minister of Information. I Minister of State.The Hon. Sir Alexander Cadogan,Permanent Under-Secretary of Statefor Foreign Affairs.Secretariat:Sir Edward Bridges.Sir Gilbert Laithwaite.Poland. The War Cabinet had before them a note (WP. (44) 612) of(Previous a conversation between the Polish Foreign Minister and the reference: Permanent Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs about theW.M. (44) 142nd Polish situation.Conclusions, A record of the discussion and of the conclusions reachedMinute 5.) is contained in the Secretary's Standard File of War cabinet conclusions.Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W. 1,1st November, 1944.[28618-1] -
